skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: AstraBit-CPT

security_audit.summary: This skill contains documentation and Python utility scripts for creating Claude Code skills. The code performs standard file operations (create, read, zip) within user-specified paths. No network calls, no credential access, no shell command execution. All capabilities are appropriate for the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Claude Code skills extend AI capabilities with specialized workflows and tools. This skill provides guidance, templates, and scripts to create, validate, and package new skills for distribution.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with SKILL.md template
Validate skill structure and frontmatter format
Apply design patterns for workflows and output formats
Structure skills with scripts, references, and assets
limitations: Does not execute arbitrary code from users
Requires manual editing of generated skill content
Cannot modify existing skills without direct user instruction
Output quality depends on user-provided skill details

use_cases.title: Standardize team workflows
use_cases.description: Create skills that encode team-specific processes, coding standards, and review procedures

use_cases.title: Package domain expertise
use_cases.description: Bundle specialized knowledge, API patterns, and best practices into reusable skills

use_cases.title: Build tool integrations
use_cases.description: Create skills with custom scripts and assets for specific tools, file formats, or platforms

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] that [brief description of purpose]

prompt_templates.title: Package existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate and package the skill at [path/to/skill] into a distributable file

prompt_templates.title: Add design patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply workflow and output patterns to improve this skill's structure and instructions

prompt_templates.title: Review skill quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this skill's SKILL.md and validate it meets all quality and structure requirements

output_examples.input: Create a skill called api-helper for working with REST APIs
output: Created scripts/, references/, and assets/ directories
Next: Edit SKILL.md with API-specific guidance and examples

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by moving detailed content to references/
Use YAML frontmatter to clearly describe when to trigger the skill
Include scripts only for deterministic, repeatedly used operations
Structure references files to enable conditional loading based on context
anti_patterns: Including README.md, CHANGELOG.md, or installation guides in the skill
Duplicating information between SKILL.md and references files
Using angle brackets in descriptions or creating deeply nested references
Adding unnecessary example files that are not used by the skill

faq.question: What file formats does the skill creator support?
faq.answer: Python scripts, markdown files, and any asset types. Skills package into .skill files which are standard ZIP archives.

faq.question: What are the size limits for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md name max 64 chars, description max 1024 chars. SKILL.md body should stay under 500 lines.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Add executable scripts to scripts/ and reference them in SKILL.md. Use the skill to guide Claude through tool-specific workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skill scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts only access paths you specify. No network calls or credential access. Files are created locally.

faq.question: Why does validation fail on my skill?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing YAML frontmatter, invalid name format (use hyphen-case), description contains angle brackets, or name/description fields are missing.

faq.question: How is this different from prompt templates?
faq.answer: Skills bundle persistent instructions, scripts, and resources. They activate contextually and can execute code without reloading into context.
